questions.question: What is the difference between a parametric and non-parametric model?
options: A parametric model is used when the data is normally distributed, while a non-parametric model is used when the data is not normally distributed
A parametric model is used when the data is not normally distributed, while a non-parametric model is used when the data is normally distributed
A parametric model is used when the data has a fixed number of parameters, while a non-parametric model is used when the data has an infinite number of parameters
A parametric model is used when the data has an infinite number of parameters, while a non-parametric model is used when the data has a fixed number of parameters
questions.answer: A parametric model is used when the data has a fixed number of parameters, while a non-parametric model is used when the data has an infinite number of parameters
